intro: Lantana camara f. portoricensis, commonly known as the Puerto Rican lantana, is a flowering shrub native to the Caribbean island of Puerto Rico. It features small, clustered flowers that range in color from yellow to orange and red, depending on the stage of bloom. The plant has opposite, simple, and hairy leaves that are generally lance-shaped. It thrives in full sun and well-drained soil, often found in coastal areas and disturbed habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated but can become invasive in certain environments.
